other_tests.findings: Bilateral visual acuity of 20/20, marked injection of the conjunctival and deep episcleral vessels on the left eye, scleral edema evident after blanching vessels.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Symptoms and signs remained unchanged over the following 7 months.

other_tests.findings: All tests were within normal limits.

other_tests.changes_over_time: No further pupillary abnormalities were reported after 2 weeks.

other_tests.findings: Visual acuity of 20/25 in the right eye and 20/70 in the left eye, with localized inferotemporal scleral edema and hyperemia of the deep episcleral vessels.

other_tests.changes_over_time: Treatment was subsequently changed due to lack of efficacy.
